name: Exploration of the New World Quiz | U.S. History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which was the first city to be founded on the present territory of the United States?
questions.explanation:
St. Augustine

	Jamestown was the first English settlement, however, St. Augustine was founded by the Spanish before the English got to the 'New World'.

questions.text: Before they came to the New World, where did the Pilgrims go?
Pennsylvania - founded by William Penn means 'Penn's woods'.
The area now known as New York City, previously had a different name. What was it?
questions.explanation:
New Amsterdam.

	It was founded on the initiative of merchants from Amsterdam. It was a Dutch colony till 1667, and was briefly reoccupied by the Dutch in the following decade.

questions.text: Who funded the expedition to Jamestown?
Where did the Pilgrims plan to land in America?
questions.explanation:
Virginia.

	The Pilgrims were funded by the Virginia Company of London. They were supposed to land slightly north of Jamestown, but a storm blew them off course. Once they saw the coastline, they realized that it wasn't Virginia, due to the rockiness of the coast and the colder climate. They had ended up in Massachusetts.

questions.text: What was the primary reason for the foundation of Maryland?
options: To house debtors from England's prisons

questions.text: What is the main reason that Georgia was founded?
questions.correct: as a barrier between English land and Spanish land
questions.explanation:
as a barrier between English land and Spanish land.

	Many of Georgia's first settlers came from English jails. The settlers were usually debtors and paupers.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT one of the original thirteen colonies?
questions.explanation:
Maine.

	Until after the Revolutionary War, the area called Maine was part of Massachusetts.

questions.text: Each region had its own type of self-government.
